intro: Peucedanum pastinacifolium, commonly known as celery root or_apium_, is a biennial or perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant features a thick, edible taproot that is often used in culinary applications. Its leaves are fern-like and can be used as a vegetable, while the flowers are small and white, typically appearing in late spring. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
